verses.text_plain: To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:
verses.verse_html: 1To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:

verses.text_plain: A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted;
verses.verse_html:
2A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted; ▼
▼ to be…: Heb. to bear

footnotes.body_html: ▼ to be…: Heb. to bear

verses.text_plain: A time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up;
verses.verse_html: 3A time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up;

verses.text_plain: A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;
verses.verse_html: 4A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;

verses.text_plain: A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;
verses.verse_html:
5A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing; ▼
▼ to refrain from: Heb. to be far from

footnotes.body_text: ▼ to refrain from: Heb. to be far from
footnotes.body_html: ▼ to refrain from: Heb. to be far from

verses.text_plain: A time to get, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away;
verses.verse_html:
6A time to get, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away; ▼
▼ get: or, seek

verses.text_plain: A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;
verses.verse_html: 7A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;

verses.text_plain: A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace.
verses.verse_html: 8A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace.

verses.text_plain: What profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboureth?
verses.verse_html: 9What profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboureth?

verses.text_plain: I have seen the travail, which God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised in it.
verses.verse_html: 10I have seen the travail, which God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised in it.

verses.text_plain: He hath made every thing beautiful in his time: also he hath set the world in their heart, so that no man can find out the work that God maketh from the beginning to the end.
verses.verse_html: 11He hath made every thing beautiful in his time: also he hath set the world in their heart, so that no man can find out the work that God maketh from the beginning to the end.

verses.text_plain: I know that there is no good in them, but for a man to rejoice, and to do good in his life.
verses.verse_html: 12I know that there is no good in them, but for a man to rejoice, and to do good in his life.

verses.text_plain: And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy the good of all his labour, it is the gift of God.
verses.verse_html: 13And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy the good of all his labour, it is the gift of God.

verses.text_plain: I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever: nothing can be put to it, nor any thing taken from it: and God doeth it, that men should fear before him.
verses.verse_html: 14I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever: nothing can be put to it, nor any thing taken from it: and God doeth it, that men should fear before him.

tokens.text: to it, nor any thing taken

verses.text_plain: That which hath been is now; and that which is to be hath already been; and God requireth that which is past.
verses.verse_html:
15That which hath been is now; and that which is to be hath already been; and God requireth that which is past. ▼
▼ that which is past: Heb. that which is driven away

tokens.text: That which hath been is now
and that which is to be hath already

footnotes.body_text: ▼ that which is past: Heb. that which is driven away
footnotes.body_html: ▼ that which is past: Heb. that which is driven away

verses.text_plain: And moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment, that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness, that iniquity was there.
verses.verse_html: 16And moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment, that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness, that iniquity was there.

verses.text_plain: I said in mine heart, God shall judge the righteous and the wicked: for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.
verses.verse_html: 17I said in mine heart, God shall judge the righteous and the wicked: for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.

verses.text_plain: I said in mine heart concerning the estate of the sons of men, that God might manifest them, and that they might see that they themselves are beasts.
verses.verse_html:
18I said in mine heart concerning the estate of the sons of men, that God might manifest them, and that they might see that they themselves are beasts. ▼
▼ that God…: or, that they might clear God, and see, etc

tokens.text: them, and that they might see

footnotes.body_text: ▼ that God…: or, that they might clear God, and see, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ that God…: or, that they might clear God, and see, etc

verses.text_plain: For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.
verses.verse_html: 19For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.

verses.text_plain: All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.
verses.verse_html: 20All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.

verses.text_plain: Who knoweth the spirit of man that goeth upward, and the spirit of the beast that goeth downward to the earth?
verses.verse_html:
21Who knoweth the spirit of man that goeth upward, and the spirit of the beast that goeth downward to the earth? ▼
▼ of man: Heb. of the sons of man
 , ▼
▼ goeth upward: Heb. is ascending, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ of man: Heb. of the sons of man
footnotes.body_html: ▼ of man: Heb. of the sons of man

footnotes.body_text: ▼ goeth upward: Heb. is ascending, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ goeth upward: Heb. is ascending, etc

verses.text_plain: Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?
verses.verse_html: 22Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?
